title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: Design Commission Final Report, Minutes, and Presentations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2024:
1. Final versions of all meeting minutes, including any attachments, from meetings where the Downtown Seattle Association (DSA) / IKE Smart City digital kiosk proposal was discussed, including but not limited to meetings held on or around April 4, 2024; June 6, 2024; September 19, 2024; and October 3, 2024.
2. All presentation materials (including slide decks) submitted to the Seattle Design Commission by the DSA, IKE Smart City, or any other party regarding the digital kiosk proposal.
3. The final report(s) and any associated recommendations issued by the Seattle Design Commission concerning the DSA/IKE Smart City digital kiosk proposal, particularly any versions dated on or after October 3, 2024.
4. All communications (including emails and attachments) between any member or staff of the Seattle Design Commission and the Office of the Mayor (including Tim Burgess) regarding the digital kiosk proposal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: Seattle IT Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) and Privacy Review

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2023:
1. The complete Surveillance Impact Report (SIR) – whether draft or final – and any equivalent privacy assessments, data governance plans, or security reviews conducted by or for Seattle IT regarding the IKE Smart City / Downtown Seattle Association digital kiosk proposal.
2. All correspondence (including emails and attachments) between Seattle IT and the Community Surveillance Working Group (CSWG) regarding the review of, or feedback on, the IKE Smart City digital kiosk proposal.
3. All communications (including emails and attachments) between any leadership or staff of Seattle IT involved in the review of the digital kiosk project and the Office of the Mayor (including Tim Burgess) regarding the proposal, its surveillance features, privacy implications, or compliance with city ordinances.
4. Any documents reflecting directives, guidance, or inquiries received from the Office of the Mayor concerning the evaluation or approval timeline of the digital kiosk project.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: SDOT Permits, Hardware Specs, and Accessibility Reviews

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2024:

1. All applications, permits (drafts and final versions), and associated review documents related to the installation and placement of interactive digital kiosks by IKE Smart City/Downtown Seattle Association in the public right-of-way.
2. Detailed hardware specifications for the exact IKE kiosk model(s) proposed for deployment in Seattle, including datasheets for all embedded cameras, microphones, and sensors (e.g., Wi-Fi/Bluetooth tracking, pedestrian counters), whether currently intended for activation or not.
3. Any internal or external reviews, assessments, or guidelines used or produced by SDOT concerning the accessibility (including but not limited to compliance with ADA or pedestrian clear zones) of the proposed digital kiosk installations.
4. All correspondence (including emails and attachments) between SDOT staff and the Office of the Mayor, the Seattle Disability Commission, the Seattle Design Commission, the Downtown Seattle Association, or IKE Smart City regarding the design, placement, permitting, or accessibility of interactive digital kiosks.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: City Council on Resolution 32170 and Public Comment

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2024:

1. All submitted public comments (written), staff reports and analyses, and presentation materials (including slide decks) provided to any Seattle City Council committee (including the Governance, Accountability & Economic Development Committee) or the full Council regarding proposed interactive digital kiosks, including proposals from IKE Smart City/Downtown Seattle Association and any related resolutions, such as Resolution 32170 considered in May 2025.

2. All ordinances, resolutions (drafts and final versions), and associated legislative documents, including any drafts of a Term Permit or Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), pertaining to the approval, funding, or regulation of interactive digital kiosks.

3. All communications (including emails and attachments) between any City Councilmember or their staff and the Office of the Mayor (including but not limited to Mayor Bruce Harrell or Tim Burgess) regarding the digital kiosk proposal, specifically concerning its surveillance aspects, privacy implications, approval process, or community feedback.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: Mayor comms with DSA, IKE, city depts

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All communications (including emails, attachments, text messages, calendar entries, memoranda, or summaries of verbal communications) sent or received by Mayor Bruce Harrell, Tim Burgess, or any staff member in the Mayor's Office acting on their behalf, regarding the proposed interactive digital kiosks (IKE Smart City/Downtown Seattle Association). This includes, but is not limited to, communications with:
- The Seattle City Council (any Councilmembers or their staff)
- The Seattle Department of Transportation (SDOT)
- The Seattle Information Technology Department (Seattle IT)
- The Seattle Design Commission
- The Seattle Disability Commission
- Representatives of the Downtown Seattle Association (DSA)
- Representatives of IKE Smart City / Orange Barrel Media
2. Any internal memoranda, briefing documents, meeting agendas, or meeting minutes within the Office of the Mayor related to the digital kiosk proposal, its review by city bodies, its surveillance or privacy implications, or strategies for its approval and implementation.
3. Records of any meetings (including attendee lists, agendas, minutes, and materials presented) where Mayor Bruce Harrell, Tim Burgess, or other staff from the Mayor's Office discussed the digital kiosk project with representatives of the Downtown Seattle Association, IKE Smart City, or other business interests.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek
